answerText: Quintus Ennius[10] The Annales, or Annals, is also the title of the masterwork of this Roman historian and senator, who also wrote a history of his father-in-law Agricola and his conquest of Britain.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 6 | 17 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Only about 600 lines of his greatest work survive. [10] Name this early Roman poet of the 3rd and 2nd centuries B.C., whose epic the Annales chronicled the history of Rome up to its founding and was immensely popular until it was eclipsed by the Aeneid.
